summary: Dedicated, Disciplined and Dynamic: My objective is to do my best and be the best in every work I undertake, with utmost benevolence and integrity.

treasury_media.title: International Conference on Stigma 2016 : Sarju Sing Rai Presentation
treasury_media.description: Presenting my Winning Scientific Research Study on "Stigma among Women living with HIV in Nepal: a double burden of disease and disparity" at the 7th International Stigma Conference at Howard University, Washington DC, USA.

awards.title: Erasmus Mundus Joint Doctorate (EMJD) Fellowship
awards.description: The Erasmus Mundus Joint Doctorate (EMJD) Fellowship is the European Union's prime fellowship program which provides integrated  joint Doctorate degree to deserving candidates following study or research at two or more higher education institutions within the EU. These doctoral-level training and research programmes offer fellowships covering up to three years of doctoral activities.

awards.title: Global Health Corps Fellowship
awards.description: Global Health Corps Fellowships are awarded to emerging Global Health leaders who are highly dedicated and committed to social justice and health equity. Through the fellowship, promising young professionals from diverse backgrounds are chosen to work on the frontlines of the fight for global health equity at high impact health organizations and government agencies. Fellows are currently working in Rwanda, Burundi, Uganda, Malawi, Zambia and the United States.
awards.issuer: Global Health Corps, New York, U.S.A

awards.title: Asian Development Bank Fellowship - Japan Scholarship Programme
awards.description: The Asian Development Bank Fellowship through its Japan Scholarship Programme provides opportunity to talented young individuals from 23 ADB recipient countries for fully funded Postgraduate studies.

authors.headline: Assistant Professor at VU Amsterdam | Competencies development through Critical, Transformative & Transdisciplinary learning |  Global Health Professional | Pharmacist |

profile_positions.description:
I am an Assistant Professor in Competencies Development through Public Engagement in Transdisciplinary Research and Education with focus on the themes - Global Health, and Health and Wellbeing (SDG 3). I am a member of the Broader mind – Community Service Learning (CSL) project of VU Amsterdam, wherein I am involved in teaching and designing transdisciplinary education with multistakeholder involvement to jointly address complex (global) health issues. I am also a part of the AURORA European Universities Alliance projects on service learning and co-creation. I am also interested in connecting higher education institutions in global South and North to build essential global connectivity and competence among students from both these regions in an equitable way.

I am involved in research on education (competencies development through transdisciplinary education, critical service learning, internationalization and global citizenship) and global health topics (health-related stigma reduction and healing, intersectionality, health equity, social justice).
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: I am currently working as a postdoctoral lecturer for Masters program courses - Research Methods, Epidemiology, Global Health, and as a researcher in the field of health and societal sciences - community service learning (CSL), global health (GH), and public health (PH).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher and Lecturer

profile_positions.description: As a PhD Researcher (Erasmus Mundus Joint Doctorate in Trans Global Health) at the Athena Institute, VU - Amsterdam, I was involved in studying health-related stigma and finding innovative solutions to reducing stigma for improved access to healthcare and better health outcomes.
profile_positions.title: PHD Researcher

profile_positions.description:
I along with other three Nepalese youth leaders co-founded "Boys for Girls’ Rights Nepal" in January of 2017 as a Nepalese youth-led community based forum which engages boys and men in the community to support women and girls'rights and gender equality. We operate under the broader framework of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) agenda in advancing and promoting the rights of Women and Girls in our community. 

*** Our Mission Statement ***
" Engage Nepalese Boys and Men to support and promote Girls'and Women's Rights, Gender Equality, Social Equity, and Empowerment "

*** Our Activities ***
- As a part of our activities we are currently mentoring young school girls in the community by connecting them with Youth mentors who provide after-school tutoring to girls from disadvantaged communities. 
- We also raise funds to buy school supplies and school dress as a means of supporting girls. 
- We are also involved in engaging men and boys in the community to discuss topics on gender equality, education, and girls empowerment with parents living in disadvantaged communities.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
As a Policy and Programs Officer at UNAIDS Liaison Office in Washington D.C., I work on advocacy and policy issues, and program analysis on areas of collaboration between the U.S. Government and UNAIDS, and with other partners like the World Bank and the Global Fund. My work entails particular focus on advancing the global goal on ending AIDS by 2030 through specific activities on gender and HIV, HIV treatment and prevention, including the elimination of pediatric AIDS (eMTCT) and HIV treatment for children, and global AIDS funding and investments. Under the supervision of the UNAIDS US Liaison Office in Washington DC, I also closely work with its partner - Together for Girls (TfG) - a public-private partnership on ending Violence against Children, on activities with HIV/AIDS intersectionality. I am further responsible in contributing to:

- Country specific problem solving work organized by/through UNAIDS US Liaison Office in partnership with UNAIDS country and regional offices and headquarters, US Government, World Bank, Global Fund and other partners

- Policies, literature reviews, data and analyses, compilations and presentations, and reports and partnerships that are led, coordinated or contributed by the UNAIDS US Liaison Office around HIV treatment, HIV prevention, gender, and strategic investments.
profile_positions.title: Policy and Programs Officer

profile_positions.description:
In my roles as an intern and then a consultant at the UNFPA Tokyo Liaison Office, I was involved in Communications and Advocacy, particularly related to Women’s rights, health, gender equality and population issues. I had been a part of UNFPA Tokyo Office’s major works on advocacy for Women’s Health, Sexual and Reproductive Health, Youth and Ageing.

I was fortunate enough to have met influential parliamentarians, ministry officials, experts, and women leaders to advocate and lobby for Women’s rights and empowerment, Gender equality, and Universal access to Sexual and Reproductive rights. The most important work I have been involved with so far through UNFPA is in successfully advocating for Women's Leadership and the inclusion of Sexual and Reproductive Health Rights in the Sendai Declaration and Framework, which is post-2015 framework for disaster risk reduction, at the World Conference on Disaster Risk Reduction (WCDRR) held in March 2015 in Japan. I also represented UNFPA in advocating and lobbying for women’s health and empowerment, gender equality, and universal access to sexual and reproductive health at the  International Conference on Universal Health Coverage and the Global Fund Fifth Replenishment Preparatory Meeting held in Japan in December 2015. I hope our work will help bring focus to the issues of Women's rights and improve the lives of women all over the world.
profile_positions.title: Intern / Consultant

profile_positions.description: As a Field/Logistics Support Officer (Public Health) for the bilateral USAID|DELIVER Project between USAID and Ministry of Health - Nepal, I worked closely with the Eastern Regional Medical Store and District Public Health Offices in the eastern region of Nepal under the Ministry of Health & Population, Government of Nepal to support in strengthening the public health logistics, particularly in procurement, quantification and distribution of key health commodities and essential drugs to the primary health care facilities in the eastern region of Nepal. I and my team were also involved in implementing the Logistics Management Information System (LMIS) and Web-based LMIS in all of the districts of the eastern region of Nepal. I also supported other public health programs in the region, viz. TB/Leprosy Program, Safe Motherhood Program and Community Based Integrated Management of Childhood Illnesses. My job responsibilty also included providing trainings to staffs of districts and health facilities, supervision of Logistics Management Information System (LMIS) reporting, Web-based LMIS implementation and Implementation of Pull system in  the region.
profile_positions.title: Field Support/Logistics Officer

profile_positions.description: As a Brand Manager, I was involved in managing and leading the Brand Management Team. I was involved in identifying new drug molecules for the company, brand placement, strategy formulation and implementation, capacity building of health care professionals and Paramedical staffs, community based health camps and health promotion campaigns, and raising public awareness on rational use of drugs. I was also involved in building relationships and maintaining network of contacts, and maintaining liaison with internal and external customers of the organization.
profile_positions.title: Brand Manager

profile_positions.description: As an Editor in Chief of PharmaQuest , a bi-annual scientific publication of Forum for Pharmacy (FoP), Department of Pharmacy, Kathmandu University, I was involved in the overall conception, review, critique/appraisal, rectification, and publishing of the issues. I, as the Editor in Chief, worked in close coordination with the President of FoP and the official publication team, which includes sub-editors, copy-editors, and members of FoP.
profile_positions.title: Editor in Chief
